text: The 2018 African Badminton Championships or All Africa Championships were held in Algiers, Algeria between 16-18 February, organised by the Badminton Confederation of Africa. ==Medalists== {| |- |rowspan=2|Men's singles |rowspan=2| Georges Paul |rowspan=2| Habeeb Temitope Bello | Clement Krobakpo |- | Aatish Lubah |- |rowspan=2|Women's singles |rowspan=2| Kate Foo Kune |rowspan=2| Dorcas Ajoke Adesokan | Doha Hany |- | Hadia Hosny |- |rowspan=2|Men's doubles |rowspan=2| Mohamed Abderrahime Belarbi Adel Hamek |rowspan=2| Koceila Mammeri Youcef Sabri Medel | Jean Bernard Bongout Christopher Paul |- | Abdelrahman Abdelhakim Ahmed Salah |- |rowspan=2|Women's doubles |rowspan=2| Juliette Ah-Wan Allisen Camille |rowspan=2| Doha Hany Hadia Hosny | Halla Bouksani Linda Mazri |- | Zainab Momoh Peace Orji |- |rowspan=2|Mixed doubles |rowspan=2| Koceila Mammeri Linda Mazri |rowspan=2| Enejoh Abah Peace Orji | Adham Hatem Elgamal Doha Hany |- | Ahmed Salah Hadia Hosny |} == Men's Singles == === Seeds === # Georges Paul (Champion) # Ahmed Salah (Third Round) # Adham Hatem Elgamal (Third Round) # Aatish Lubah (Semifinals) # Clement Krobakpo (Semifinals) # Abdelrahman Abdelhakim (Third Round) # Emmanuel Donkor (Quarterfinals) #
